title: Poster, "Minute Man National Historic Park", 1974
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
signed: In black marker lower left center: Paul Rand '74
inscribed:
Imprinted in black on the green E at right center: Minute Man National Historical Park / National Park Service / U.S. Department of the Interior
Imprinted in black lower left across edge: For sale by the Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Printing Office, Washington, D.C. 2042-02/ Price $1.80/Stock No. 2405-00566/ [star] GPO: 1974 0-564-174
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Poster composed of three equal horizontal registers comprised of the letters of the word "Minuteman." Across the top: M I N; at center: U T E; at bottom: M A N. The M at upper left contains a black and white photographic reproduction of the face of the Minuteman commerative public sculpture of the same name.Each letter is is given a color as follows: I - yellow; N - scarlet red; U - red; T - brown; E - green; M - blue; A - red orange; N - forest green.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Minute Man National Historic Park", 1974.
1974. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-244.
